content:
• Thursday, August 25, 2016
  • KGC

    Kinross Gold to suspend Maricunga mine in Chile

    • Kinross Gold (NYSE:KGC) +4.6% AH after confirming it has suspended operations and dismissed 300 employees at its Maricunga gold mine in Chile, after a judicial decision upheld a move by the country's environmental regulator to shut the water system linked to the mine.
    • KGC says the suspension of the Maricunga operations is not likely to affect its 2016 production and cost forecast, although the mine accounted for 8% of its total gold production in 2015.
    • KGC also says it has resumed operations at its Tasiast mine in Mauritania following its temporary suspension caused by an expatriate work permit issue.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:57 PM | 3 Comments

  • After Hours Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers, as of 5.25 p.m.: PSTG +10.7%. OCN +10.1%. HMY +5.6%. KGC +4.6%. QGEN +1.7%.
    • Top losers, as of 5.25p.m.: TLND -22.3%. GME -7.7%. SPLK -4.8%. SYNA -4.5%. AU -2.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:33 PM
  • SPLK

    Splunk down 6% despite better-than-expected Q2, increased guidance

    • Splunk (NASDAQ:SPLK) registered 43.5% Y/Y revenue ($212.8M) growth, 32% Y/Y license revenue ($115.7M) growth, operating income of $8.2M, operating margin of 3.9% and operating cash flow of $18.3M.
    • Projects Q3 total revenue of $228M-$230M, operating margin of 5%-6% and FY 2017 total revenue of $910M-$914M (previously $892M-$896M) and operating margin of 5% (unchanged).
    • Splunk is up around 9% on the month, around 18% over the last three and nearly 6% on the year.
    • Conference call
     
     
     
     
    | 5:06 PM | 9 Comments
  • GME

    GameStop lower after sales disappoint

    • GameStop (NYSE:GME) reports same-store sales plunged 11% in Q2. Sales of new video game hardware fell to 33% Y/Y during the quarter.
    • Revenue mix: New video game hardware $216.4M (13.3% of total), New video game software $382M (23.4%), Pre-owned and value video game products $543M (33.3%), Video game accessories $120M (7.3%), Digital $36M (2.2%), Mobile and consumer electronics $203M (13%), Collectibles $90M (5.5%).
    • The company's gross profit rate rose 500 bps to 37.9% off the shift in mix.
    • GameStop expects FQ3 comparable-store sales to fall in a range of -2% to +1%. Q3 EPS of $0.53-$0.58 is expected.
    • Previously: GameStop EPS in-line, misses on revenue (Aug. 25)
    • GME -6.44% AH to $30.09.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:00 PM | 19 Comments
  • CEI

    Lucas Energy reaches funding deal for Eagle Ford drilling

    • Lucas Energy (LEI) +9.8% AH after reaching agreement with its senior lender to borrow $1M toward the drilling and completion of Eagle Ford wells under a joint operating agreement with Lonestar Resources and improvement maintenance operations on its existing assets.
    • LEI says the agreement with LONE covers more than 1,450 gross acres, and the company says its participation will vary between 8%-14% working interest in the units.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:58 PM
  • PSTG

    Pure Storage posts 92.8% Y/Y Q2 revenue increase; +11% after hours

    • Revenue of $163.2M ($153M-$157M guided).
    • Started shipping FlashBlade during the quarter, and although confident on the development, Pure Storage (NYSE:PSTG) CEO Scott Dietzen doesn't expect it to materially affect revenue this year.
    • Projects Q3 revenue of $187M-$195M (consensus $190.7M), gross margin of 64%-67% and operating margin in the range of -17.5% to -13.5%.
    • Dietzen: "We are very pleased with the growth of the business in the July quarter, driven by solid repeat purchase rates, by partnering with the channel to accelerate our go-to-market, by healthy demand from cloud customers ‒ which accounts for more than 25% of our business ‒ and by growing sales to international customers, who made up 25% of revenue."
    • Conference call
    • CEO blog
     
     
     
     
    | 4:47 PM
  • PSTG

    Pure Storage beats by $0.07, beats on revenue

    • Pure Storage (NYSE:PSTG): FQ2 EPS of -$0.16 beats by $0.07.
    • Revenue of $163.2M (+92.7% Y/Y) beats by $8.06M.
    • Shares +14%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM
  • ADSK

    Autodesk beats by $0.18, beats on revenue

    • Autodesk (NASDAQ:ADSK): Q2 EPS of $0.05 beats by $0.18.
    • Revenue of $550.7M (-9.6% Y/Y) beats by $38.63M.
    • Shares +6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:02 PM | 1 Comment
  • BRCD

    Brocade Communications Systems beats by $0.05, beats on revenue

    • Brocade Communications Systems (NASDAQ:BRCD): FQ3  EPS of $0.21 beats by $0.05.
    • Revenue of $591M (+7.1% Y/Y) beats by $17.57M.
    • Shares +1.82%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:02 PM | 1 Comment
  • VNDA

    Vanda rebuffs would-be Fanapt generic competitor; shares up 20%

    • Vanda Pharmaceuticals (VNDA +19.8%) perks up on a 10x surge in volume in response to its announcement that a U.S. district court has ruled in its favor in a patent infringement suit against Roxanne Laboratories. Roxanne filed an abbreviated New Drug Application (ANDA) with the FDA seeking approval to market a generic version of Vanda's Fanapt (iloperidone). The judge ruled that Roxanne's ANDA infringed on Vanda's U.S. Patent Nos. RE39,198 and 8,586,610. Roxanne will be unable to launch a generic product until November 2, 2027.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:54 PM
  • BOFI

    Clean 10-K filing sends BofI higher

    • The lender's annual report revealed no new regulatory news and included a "clean" audit option, says Craig-Hallum Capital, reiterating its Buy rating and $35 price target (vs. current $22.20).
    • BOFI is up 6.1% today on more than double the normal volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:50 PM | 8 Comments
  • EURN

    Euronav downgraded at Morgan Stanley as tanker industry enters downturn

    • Euronav (EURN -8.1%) is downgraded to Equal Weight from Overweight with a $9.50 price target at Morgan Stanley, which says the tanker industry is entering a cyclical downturn that likely will last through 2018, and the near-term market outlook for crude tankers also looks to remain weak.
    • However, the firm likes EURN's robust free cash flow due to its low leverage and cost structure, adding that “EURN's low debt and its large VLCC fleet and high trading liquidity make it a favorable trading stock to play the high volatility and seasonality of the crude tanker rates.”
     
     
     
     
    | 3:47 PM | 11 Comments
  • IP

    Paper stocks perk up with higher pricing coming down the road

    • Paper stocks are higher on word that pricing will increase in the sector. The analysis is based off a look at October contracts.
    • Buckingham Research is on top of the siutuation, already tweeting that it raised price targets on International Paper (IP +4.2%), Packaging Corp of America (PKG +2.7%), and WestRock (WRK +5.3%).
    • KapStone Paper and Packaging (KS +6.4%) and Clearwater Paper (CLW +1.2%) also broke higher in afternoon trading.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:08 PM | 5 Comments

  • Technology - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 3:00 pm

    • Gainers: CPSH +17%. AAOI +16%. RAX +8%. I +8%. WDAY +7%.
    • Losers: MARK -10%. TRUE -8%. LTRX -8%. PTI -7%. JKS -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:00 PM | 1 Comment
  • REN

    Resolute Energy -9% as CEO set to depart; Street Sweeper is negative

    • Resolute Energy (REN -9.2%) sinks following yesterday's news that Nicholas Sutton, who has run the company since its founding in 2004, will resign as CEO effective Jan. 1.
    • Shares also may be hurt by a negative report from The Street Sweeper, which sees shares dropping 70% due to the coming leadership change, the recent reverse split, massive financial concerns and "absurd reports" from financial institutions.
    • REN jumped following the company's Q2 results that included higher production guidance, but the report notes that recent output is 4%-7% lower than the previous two years.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:45 PM | 6 Comments
  • ESI-OLD

    ITT Educational Services craters after DOE pulls new federal aid

    • Shares of ITT Educational Services (ESI-OLD -31.2%) plunge after the Department of Education announces new enforcement actions against the company in a new blog post.
    • DOE actions: "We’re no longer allowing ITT to enroll new students with federal aid. In addition, in case the school’s actions cause it to close, we’re increasing the amount of cash reserves it must send us and we’re ending its installment payment plan for the amount previously required. Finally, we’re slowing down when ITT receives student aid from the government to ensure that ITT is handling its finances properly."
     
     
     
     
    | 2:35 PM | 14 Comments

  • Energy/Materials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 2:00 pm

    • Gainers: SGY +10%. GBR +9%. RKDA +7%. SQM +5%. MGN +5%.
    • Losers: REN -11%. SYMX -9%. NOG -8%. FI -7%. MBII -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:01 PM
  • NOMD

    Nomad Foods gears up for more M&A

    • Nomad Foods (NYSE:NOMD) is back on the hunt for companies to acquire, according to CEO Stefan Descheemaeker.
    • The exec says mid-sized frozen foods makers in Europe are the most attractive targets for the company due to the synergies they could deliver.
    • Nomad picked up foods assets from Findus Sverige AB last year.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:44 PM | 1 Comment

  • Financials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 1:00 PM

    • Gainers: YRD +7%. BOFI +6%.
    • Losers: IFMI -8%. GWGH -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:00 PM
  • MU

    Micron Technology +6%, Western Digital +3% following HP component-shortage comments

    • HP reported Q3 results yesterday and on its earnings call, CEO Dion Weisler noted "some shortages, particularly around LCDs, DRAM and Flash memory."
    • Susquehanna analyst Mehdi Hosseini notes potential resulting favorability for Micron Technology (MU +6%), Western Digital (WDC +3%) and Corning (GLW +0.4%). The firm upgraded Micron to a Positive rating and $18 price target ($16.45 current price) in late June.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM | 12 Comments

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: AEPI +43%. GES +24%. SSY +23%. VNDA +19%. ITUS +15%. CPSH +18%. CORI +14%. NYMX +14%. CEMI +14%. CADC +13%.
    • Losers: DG -14%. SIG -13%. AMDA -13%. MARK -12%. RIBT -11%. NM -11%. DXLG -9%. MDGS -9%. DLTR -9%. STJ -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • YGE

    Yingli Green Energy rated Sell at Axiom, citing renewed solvency concerns

    • Yingli Green Energy (YGE -3%) is maintained with a Sell rating by Axiom Capital's Gordon Johnson, who says the company likely will report its Q3 EBIT in the red which could worsen in 2017.
    • Johnson says YGE’s Q2 profitability is unlikely to repeat, as China has imposed a PV demand freeze in H2, while newly established PV capacity already is surpassing demand in 2016.
    • The market is overcrowded and recent checks suggest continued decline in already record-low ASPs, which Johnson says likely will spark “renewed investor concern surrounding YGE’s solvency."
     
     
     
     
    | 12:43 PM | 1 Comment

  • Consumer Goods - Top Gainers / Losers as of 12:00 pm

    • Gainers: AEPI +43%. JBSS +10%. DFBG-OLD +6%. VUZI +5%.
    • Losers: RIBT -10%. SORL -7%. MOV -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:02 PM
  • SQM

    Reuters: Chinese maker of lithium battery materials bids to buy SQM stake

    • Sociedad Quimica y Minera (SQM +5.3%) shoots higher following a Reuters report that Chinese lithium battery materials manufacturer Ningbo Shanshan is in advanced talks to buy a stake in the Chilean company.
    • The deal is another example of the growing interest in lithium, whose price has been rising on hopes of an electric vehicle boom, and is latest sign of a Chinese acquisition binge in Latin America.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:58 AM | 2 Comments
  • AMZN

    TrueCar -9%, Autobytel -5% as Amazon Vehicles launches

    • Amazon (AMZN +0.1%) earlier revealed a new research and community portal offering users access to specifications, photos, videos and reviews for thousands of new and used vehicle models.
    • Though these businesses and Amazon's new service are not fully identical, the further extension of Amazon into the automotive arena does not bode well for them and others as it has the resources and technology to do what they do equally as well, if not better, and on a larger scale.
    • TrueCar (TRUE -8.6%) is presently trading up around 100% on the year while Autobytel (ABTL -5%) is more or less unchanged (-2%).
    • Amazon Vehicles
     
     
     
     
    | 11:50 AM | 41 Comments
  • CEMI

    Chembio snags government contract to develop POC test for Zika; shares up 16%

    • The U.S. Department of Health and Human Services' Biomedical Advanced Research and Development Authority (BARDA) awards a $13.2M contract to Chembio Diagnostics (CEMI +16.4%) to develop and commercialize a rapid point-of-care (POC) test for the Zika virus and other Zika-related products.
    • The initial commitment of $5.9M will fund the development of the DPP Zika IgM/IgG Assay and DPP Micro Reader. There is an option for an additional $7.3M that will fund the development and regulatory submissions for the company's DPP Zika/Chikungunya/Dengue IgM/IgG Combination Assay.
    • The DPP test detects IgM and IgG antibodies to Zika, Denque and Chikungunya in 10 uL fingerstick blood samples. Qualitative (positive/negative) results are generated in 15 minutes.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:50 AM | 1 Comment
  • LLL

    L-3 named top defense pick at J.P. Morgan; Northrop downgraded

    • L-3 Communications (LLL +1.5%) is J.P. Morgan's new top pick among defense stocks, upgrading shares to Overweight from Neutral with a $182 price target, raised from $158, while downgrading Northrop Grumman (NOC +0.4%) to Neutral from Overweight with a $231 price target.
    • The firm expects L-3 to generate 5% compound annual free cash flow growth through 2020, the second highest level among the defense stocks it covers, while the stock trades at the second lowest free cash flow multiple among the defense stocks covered.
    • But JPM recommends taking profits on NOC, saying cash flow estimates are below consensus due to capex projections, the company's cash return yield is no longer exceptional, and it has a low dividend yield.
    • The firm maintains Lockheed Martin (LMT +0.3%) with a Neutral rating and $284 price target.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:47 AM | 7 Comments
  • STJ

    Muddy Waters says big chunk of St. Jude Medical's business at risk due to hacking vulnerability; shares off 4%

    • St. Jude Medical (STJ -3.8%) eases on increased volume in response to a report by short seller Muddy Waters Capital that alleges almost 50% of the company's revenue could disappear over the next two years if it has to recall and fix hacking vulnerabilities in its pacers, ICDs and CRTs.
    • Muddy claims it has seen demonstrations of two types of cyber attacks against the company's implantable cardiac devices that cause them to malfunction, including pacing at a potentially dangerous rate and an accelerated battery drain. It also says it was able to replicate the hacks in-house. Most troubling is its assertion that the hacks require less skill and can be directed at any St. Jude device within a 50-foot radius.
    • Update: In its full report, Muddy says communication protocols in St. Jude's device ecosystem (the devices, the company's Merlin.net network, physician office programmers, home monitoring devices) lack basic protections such as encryption and authentication. The most vulnerable appear to be the home monitoring units called Merlin@home which are available online for as little as $11. Hundreds of thousands have already been distributed into the field.
    • The vulnerabilities were discovered by a cybersecurity research outfit called MedSec, the group that conducted the demonstrations for Muddy. MedSec showed that a hacker can reverse engineer the communication protocol and impersonate parts of the ecosystem, including the cardiac devices.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:31 AM | 12 Comments
  • TLYS

    Tilly's races higher after earnings

    • Tilly's (TLYS +7.5%) rallies after surprising on the upside with Q2 results.
    • "Our second quarter comp sales and operating income exceeded our outlook ranges and we ended the quarter with inventory down 7% on a per square foot basis," summed up CEO Ed Thomas.
    • Tilly's expanded its margin rates during the quarter, despite only a 0.9% in gain comparable sales.
    • Shares of tilly's are at their highest level since mid-March.
    • Previously: Tilly's beats by $0.08, beats on revenue (Aug. 24)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:10 AM
  • EROS

    Eros International jumps 5.9% on Reliance Jio integration deal

    • India-industry film firm Eros International (NYSE:EROS) has jumped 5.9% in the past few minutes on word of a key integration deal with mobile provider Reliance Jio.
    • The company's over-the-top platform Eros Now will power Jio On Demand, Jio's entertainment offering.
    • Jio customers get access to thousands of movies, while Eros Now gets a line into new subscribers in urban and rural areas alike.
    • Eros Now has more than 44M registered users and is targeting 1M paying subscribers by the end of fiscal 2017. It costs 49 rupees (about $0.73) per month for streaming and 99 rupees (about $1.47) for a higher-end subscription with more features.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:07 AM | 1 Comment

  • Healthcare - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 11:00 am

    • Gainers: SSY +20%. CEMI +15%. SPHS +11%. CYCC +10%. NYMX +11%.
    • Losers: AMDA -13%. GALT -9%. MDGS -9%. LCI -8%. HWAY -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM | 25 Comments
  • OZM

    Och-Ziff rally snuffed as Citi downgrades

    • The roughed-up shares of Och-Ziff (NYSE:OZM) had managed about a 25% rally this month, but they're down 4.25% this morning after Citigroup's Willliam Katz downgrades to Sell from Neutral.
    • The price target is cut from $4.25 to $3.40 (current level is $3.85).
     
     
     
     
    | 10:48 AM
  • HMY

    Harmony Gold says big purchase a "necessity" to fund Golpu, offset closures

    • Harmony Gold (HMY +4.5%) CEO Peter Steenkamp says he is willing to use debt and equity to buy a profitable mine that will offset falling production in South Africa and help fund its new Golpu copper-gold project in Papua New Guinea.
    • With the miner likely to lose ~40% of its current production over the next six years due to mines reaching the end of their lives, a big acquisition is “a necessity,” Steenkamp says.
    • HMY says it has the capacity to raise ~5B rand in debt but would consider using its stock to make a big acquisition, which would need to have at least 1M oz. of reserves, produce 100K oz./year and bring the company’s overall costs down to $950/oz.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:25 AM
  • PVCT

    Provectus prices equity offering; shares plummet 48%

    • Thinly traded nano cap Provectus Biopharmaceuticals (OTC:PVCT -48%) slumps on a 4x surge in volume in response to the pricing of its "best efforts" public equity offering.
    • The company is offering 240K shares of Series B Convertible Preferred Stock, initially convertible into an aggregate of 24M shares of common stock, and warrants to purchase up to 24M shares of common at a price of $25 for a combination of one Series B share and one immediately exercisable five-year warrant to purchase one share of common at $0.275.
    • If successful, gross proceeds will be ~$6M. Closing date is August 30.
    • Net proceeds will fund clinical development, working capital and general corporate purposes.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:17 AM | 25 Comments
  • PVH

    Phillips-Van Heusen higher after guidance lift

    • Phillips-Van Heusen (PVH +1.2%) is higher after the company flew past estimates with its Q2 report.
    • The company kept a lid on costs and sales for Calvin Kein North America were notably improved during the quarter.
    • PVH now sees FY16 EPS falling in a range of $6.55 to $6.65, up from prior guidance of $6.45 to $6.55.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:05 AM | 2 Comments
  • DLTR

    Did Wal-Mart take it to the dollar stores this summer?

    • A common theory from analysts is that dollar stores are in the sweet spot of retail - somewhat shielded from the Amazon Effect and geared toward a demographic in which consumers are seeing a meaningful benefit from higher wages and low gas prices.
    • That premise could be questioned after discounters Dollar Tree (DLTR -6.9%) and Dollar General (DG -10.8%) both disappointed with their Q2 earnings and were perhaps surprisingly outperformed by retail giant Wal-Mart (WMT +0.2%).
    • Though the reporting periods don't match up exactly, Wal-Mart showed a 1.6% increase in U.S. comparable sales in Q2 to top Dollar General's 0.7% mark and Dollar Tree's 1.2% pace. It should be noted that at Wal-Mart's scale every basis point of comp gain means a significant amount of extra revenue to help lever down costs.
    • In early trading, Five Below (FIVE -3.7%) and Big Lots (BIG -3.4%) are both lower due to the dollar store earnings disappointment.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:35 AM | 11 Comments

  • Premarket Gainers / Losers as of 9:10 am

    • Gainers: NYMX +19%. GES +16%. EDAP +9%. WDAY +9%. TIF +7%. BLDP +7%. SFUN +6%.
    • Losers: KOOL -11%. SIG -10%. DG -9%. DLTR -8%. HPQ -6%. EURN -5%. JKS -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:16 AM | 2 Comments
  • SIG

    Signet to funnel PE investment proceeds into buybacks

    • Signet (NYSE:SIG) announces that affiliates of Leonard Gren & Partners will purchase $625M worth of convertible preferred shares. The transaction is expected to close in Q3.
    • The company plans to add the proceeds from the PE firm to its buyback allowance which will take it to $1.1B.
    • Previously: Signet misses by $0.31, misses on revenue (Aug. 25)
    • Previously: Signet sinks after weak results and guidance cut (Aug. 25)
    • Shares of Signet are down 9.95% premarket to $85.95, recovering somewhat from the early post-earnings slide.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:06 AM | 3 Comments
  • SHLDQ

    More losses and more lifelines at Sears Holdings

    • Sears Holdings (SHLD) says it took on $300M in debt financing from the hedge fund owned by CEO Eddie Lampert.
    • The company previously disclosed that ESL Investments kicked in $125M of an initial $250M loan.
    • In another development, Sears says it has received interest from retailers and manufacturers for the Sears Home Services business and the unit that holds Kenmore, Craftsman, and DieHard.
    • Over the last five years shares of Sears have lost 74% of their value, while other large chains such as Wal-Mart (+37%), Macy's (+64%), Target (+41%), and L Brands (+112%) have adjusted their models more successfully.
    • Sears saw another drop in margin rates during Q2, despite the trimming of select stores seen as underperforming. A "challenging" retail environment was cited again.
    • Previously: Sears Holdings beats by $1.45, beats on revenue (Aug. 25)
    • Previously: More on Sears Holdings' Q2 (Aug. 25)
    • SHLD -5.44% premarket to $13.90.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:59 AM | 28 Comments
  • CRH

    CRH reports 1H results

    • CRH (NYSE:CRH): 1H EPS of €0.336.
    • Revenue of €12.7B (+35.1% Y/Y).
    • Shares +4% PM.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:58 AM
  • BURL

    Burlington Stores higher post Q2 results

    • Burlington Stores (NYSE:BURL) reports comparable-store sales rose 5.4% in Q2.
    • Gross margin rate up 40 bps to 39.6%.
    • SG&A expense rate improved 110 bps to 27.3%.
    • Adjusted EBITDA increased 31.4% to $99.1M.
    • Merchandise Inventories -7.1% Y/Y to $745M.
    • Q3 Guidance: Net sales: +7.1% to +8.1%; Comparable-store sales: +2.5% to +3.5%; Adjusted diluted EPS: $0.30 to $0.32; Fully diluted share count: ~72M.
    • FY2016 Guidance: Net sales: +7.8% to +8.3%; Comparable-store sales: +3.6% to +4.1%; Adjusted EBITDA margin: +50 bps to +60 bps; Interest expense: ~$59M; Adjusted diluted EPS: $2.92 to $2.96; Fully diluted share count: ~72.1M; Net new stores: 25.
    • BURL +3.18% premarket.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:41 AM
  • KOOL

    Cesca issues 6.1M new common shares in debt conversion; stock down 24% premarket

    • Thinly traded nano cap Cesca Therapeutics (NASDAQ:KOOL) is off 24% premarket on light volume in response to its announcement that it has converted a $12.5M senior secured three-year convertible debenture and $8.25M in interest to 6,102,941 shares of common stock. The action was in accordance with an investment by affiliates of Chinese institutional investor Boyalife Group made in February.
    • The conversion increases Boyalife's stake in Cesca to 70% (6.838,235 shares).
    • Previously: Cesca Therapeutics bags $15M capital infusion from Chinese investment group (Feb. 3)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:40 AM
  • SDRL

    Seadrill +4% as Q2 earnings beat estimates, says oil industry may be turning

    • Seadrill (NYSE:SDRL) +4.3% premarket after Q2 earnings fell 31% Y/Y amid lower rig rates but beat analyst estimates thanks to $285M in cost cuts YTD en route to fulfilling its revised 2016 cost-cutting target to $390M.
    • Q2 EBITDA fell 14% Y/Y to $557M from $651M but exceeded the $510M analyst consensus as well as the company's own guidance; SDRL expects EBITDA will drop to $380M in Q3 and total $1.8B for the full year, implying a further decline to $335M in Q4.
    • Eight of SDRL's rigs are coming off contracts during Q3 or will be idle for a longer period than in Q2, and three of its rigs will be paid lower rates.
    • However, the company senses "a growing belief that we are at or near the bottom of this downcycle. There is a growing realization that the current level of investment is not sustainable and increased capital expenditure will be required to slow decline curves and grow production at some point."
    • SDRL reiterates that it expects to conclude the refinancing process of its $10M debt by year-end.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:19 AM | 41 Comments
  • EDAP

    EDAP TMS S.A. revenues up 6% in Q2; shares up 29% premarket

    • EDAP TMS S.A. (EDAP) Q2 results: Revenues: $9.2M (+5.7%); Operating Loss: ($0.4M); Net Income: $2.8M; EPS: $0.09; Quick Assets: $24.2M (+45.8%).
    • Shares up 29% premarket on increased volume.
    • No guidance given.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:02 AM | 3 Comments
  • TIF

    Tiffany positive post Q2 results

    • Tiffany (NYSE:TIF) reports net sales declined 6% in Q2 on a constant currency basis.
    • Comparable-store sales fell 8% Y/Y.
    • Geographic revenue growth: Americas: $434M (-9%); Asia-Pacific: $230M (-6%); Japan: $138M (+10%); Europe: $111M (-12%); Other: $18M (-3%).
    • Gross margin rate improved 200 bps to 61.9%.
    • SG&A expense rate rose 80 bps to 43.2%.
    • Operating margin expanded 140 bps to 18.8%.
    • Inventory -1.4% to $2.32B.
    • Store count +7 Y/Y to 311.
    • FY2016 Guidance: Net sales: decline by a low single-digit percentage; Diluted EPS: decline by a mid-single-digit percentage; Free cash flow: at least $400M; Capex: $260M.

  • MYL

    Mylan takes Clinton's comments to heart, will cover up to $300 of out-of-pocket costs for EpiPen; shares up 3% premarket

    • Democratic Presidential candidate Hillary Clinton's bully pulpit directed at Mylan N.V. (NASDAQ:MYL) over the high price of EpiPen (epinephrine injection, USP) Auto-Injector worked.
    • The company announces a more generous patient assistance program to reduce out-of-pocket costs as much as 50% off the list price via a savings card that will cover up to $300 of the cost of the EpiPen 2-Pak. In addition, Mylan is doubling the eligibility for its patient assistance program to 400% of the federal poverty level which will eliminate out-of-pocket costs for the uninsured and under-insured. A family of four with an annual income of up to $97,200, for example, will pay nothing for their EpiPen Auto-Injector.
    • Mylan will continue its EpiPen4Schools program, which was launched in August 2012. It has provided more than 700K free EpiPen Auto-Injectors and educational resources to more than 65K schools across the country.
    • To further reduce patient costs, the company is opening a pathway whereby patients can order EpiPen directly from the company. All programs apply to EpiPen Jr as well.
    • CEO Heather Bresch says, "We have been a long-term committed partner to the allergy community and are taking immediate action to help insure that everyone who needs EpiPen Auto-Injector gets one. We recognize the significant burden on patients from continued rising insurance premiums and being forced increasingly to pay the full list price for medicines at the pharmacy counter. Patients deserve increased price transparency and affordable care, particularly as the system shifts significant costs to them. However, price is only one part of the problem that we are addressing with today's actions. All involved must also take steps to help meaningfully address the U.S. healthcare crisis, and we are committed to do our part to drive change in collaboration with policymakers, payors, patients and healthcare professionals."
    • MYL is up 3% premarket on increased volume.

  • AMGN

    FDA rejects Amgen's Parsabiv NDA for secondary hyperparathyroidism; shares down 1% premarket

    • Amgen (NASDAQ:AMGN) is down 1% premarket on light volume in response to its announcement that it received a Complete Response Letter (CRL) from the FDA related to its New Drug Application (NDA) seeking approval of Parsabiv (etelcalcetide) for the treatment of secondary hyperparathyroidism (sHPT) in adult patients with chronic kidney disease (CKD) on hemodialysis.
    • It is reviewing the CRL and intends to meet with the agency later this year to discuss the matter.
    • About 88% of of dialysis patients and 79% of hemodialysis patients will develop sHPT, an excessive secretion of parathyroid hormone (PTH) by the parathyroid glands in response to decreased renal function and impaired mineral metabolism. Elevated PTH can lead to an increase in the release of calcium and phosphorus from the bones (osteoporosis).
    • Etelcalcetide is a novel calcimimetic that suppresses the secretion of parathyroid hormone. It acts by binding to and activating the calcium-sensing receptor on the parathyroid gland, which causes a decrease in the hormone. It is administered intravenously at the end of the hemodialysis session.

  • Asian shares drift as market awaits Jackson Hole Conference

    • Asian shares are mixed ahead of the opening of the central bankers' symposium at Jackson Hole today.
    • With nothing much going on this week - and with many of their colleagues probably lying on a beach somewhere - traders who are at work have been focusing on what Fed Chair Janet Yellen might say in a speech tomorrow about possible interest-rate rises in the U.S.
    • Macro-strategist Kay Van-Petersen may well be speaking for many, though, in her assertion that "people are reading way, way too much" into the conference.
    • "People are almost creating scenarios because they want direction (in the market)," Van-Petersen says. "From our perspective, it just doesn't make sense for Yellen to posture (to one side or the other).
    • National Australia Bank's Ray Attrill believes that the bigger talking point should be how effective already stretched monetary policy could be in overcoming a possible slump.
    • Japan -0.3%, Hong Kong +0.2%, China -0.3%, India +0.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:53 AM
